Development#

This section contains information for developers and contributors.

Contributing#

We welcome contributions to PyDataUtil! Whether it’s bug reports, feature requests, or code contributions, we appreciate your help in making this library better.

How to Contribute#

  1. Set up your development environment: Fork the repository, clone it, and install the development dependencies:

    git clone https://github.com/yourusername/pydatautil.git
cd pydatautil
pip install -e ".[dev]"

  2. Make your changes: Create a branch for your changes and implement them, following our coding standards.

  3. Add tests: Add tests that cover your changes and ensure all tests pass.

  4. Document your changes: Update the documentation to reflect your changes.

  5. Submit a pull request: Push your changes to your fork and submit a pull request to the main repository.

Release Process#

PyDataUtil follows semantic versioning. Here’s how we handle releases:

  • Major releases (X.0.0): Backward-incompatible changes.

  • Minor releases (0.X.0): New features with backward compatibility.

  • Patch releases (0.0.X): Bug fixes and minor improvements.

Roadmap#

Here are the key features and improvements we’re planning for upcoming releases:

  • Performance optimizations: Enhancing the performance of core operations

  • Extended API: Adding more data manipulation capabilities

  • Better integration: Improved integration with other data science libraries

  • Visualization enhancements: More plot types and customization options
